;

不是如果，何时

我相信拜登总统很快就会宣布退出2024年竞选。正如任何看过广告或徽标的人都认为自己是广告和设计方面的专家一样，我也确信自己对环城公路的内部运作有深入的了解。我不。然而，我确实了解男性的自我、家庭动态和情景规划。

拜登阵营一直在讲述的故事是：“事情比他们想象的要好，乔是最好的选择。要么是他，要么是混乱。”

任何叙述都有其自己的生命，上周，叙述如此猛烈地追尾了现实，以至于在安全气囊泄气后，出现了一个令人震惊的停顿，然后迅速变成了恐慌。恐慌才是正确的情绪。我们最担心的事情暴露在我们面前——加上让媒体和管理人员操纵我们的尴尬感。

但沟通是与听众进行的，尽管证据无处不在，但我们民主党人已经进入了自我放逐，远离真相。

拜登参加媒体露面和新闻发布会的次数比近代历史上任何一位总统都少。这是自里根以来最少的一次，里根在 74 岁时开始出现阿尔茨海默氏症的迹象。最后三位赢得连任的总统（克林顿、布什、奥巴马）第二任期开始时的平均年龄为 52 岁。如果他回到宾夕法尼亚大道，他会比拜登年轻三岁。民主党人和媒体向生物学界写了一封愤怒的公开信：年龄歧视。生物学的反应：拿着我的啤酒。

我们怎么可以这么蠢呢？

当前的叙述

现在的叙述是“我是一个老人，更糟糕的是，我是另一个不肯让路的恶性自恋者。”

这在政治上相当于打开收音机，再次听到约翰·传奇的《All of Me》。一次又一次。结果？上周，特朗普在可能选民中的领先优势从3% 上升至 6% ，这对于大多数人已经下定决心的竞选来说是一个重大转变。

多年来，民主党人一直（正确地）说特朗普不适合担任总统。 “好吧，现在拜登也来吧，”宇宙说道。是的，受损的拜登仍然会成为一名更好的第二任总统，但我们可能永远不会知道。现在的民意调查显示，温和派和年轻选民将选择犯罪而不是衰老。真正的问题是特朗普对拜登的辩论表现保持沉默。特朗普迫切希望拜登留在竞选中。如果/当拜登获得提名，并且没有回头路，特朗普媒体机器将把他变成植物人。

志向

野心本身并不是一件坏事。这是创新、财富创造和生活中许多其他美好事物的来源。然而，当它压倒了我们根据事实而不是情感做出决定和行动的（微弱的）能力时，它可能会变得病态。

埃斯蒂斯·凯福弗 (Estes Kefauver) 是一位因对黑手党的调查而闻名的参议员，他有句著名的俏皮话：“总统野心是一种只能通过防腐液才能治愈的疾病。”乔·拜登长期以来一直遇到不好的情况。

在他对 1988 年总统竞选的经典报道《What It Takes 》中，记者理查德·本·克莱默 (Richard Ben Cramer) 援引一名助手的话说，他警告 46 岁的拜登，竞选意味着牺牲朋友、家人和他的整个生活：“你会希望事情变得更糟比任何事情都重要，而且它将接管一切。”拜登的回答基本上是：“我愿意冒这个险。”

在 2020 年的一次竞选活动中，拜登表示：“我将自己视为一座桥梁，而不是其他任何东西。你看到我身后站着整整一代领导人。他们是这个国家的未来。”但从那时起，81 岁的他就坚信自己就是未来。精算图表表明他所剩的（未来）已经不多了。让我们忽略认知能力下降——还有其他因素让治理变得更加困难：死亡。根据精算表，他在第二任期结束前去世的可能性超过三分之一。注：这对特朗普来说并没有好多少，但（提示愤怒/否认机器）他看起来更坚强。

能够优雅地离开是一种天赋，许多其他方面很优秀的人都没有这种能力。面对所有医学和政治证据，露丝·巴德·金斯伯格 (Ruth Bader Ginsburg) 拒绝在民主党提名她的继任者时从最高法院退休，这阻碍了妇女权利的发展。尽管她做了很多好事，但她最终的遗产是她促成了罗伊诉韦德案的推翻。同样，如果拜登今年 11 月输给特朗普，这将是人们对他唯一的记忆。

太快了

一个在社会和职业上被低估的超级大国——以及伟大品牌所做的事情——正在制造一种稀缺感。实现这一目标的最简单方法是尽早离开而不是太晚离开。

为什么聪明人会忽视这些常识性建议？关于人类自欺欺人的能力有大量研究。威廉·S·巴勒斯 (William S. Burroughs) 将人类分为骗子和标记，他直言不讳地说：“世界上的骗子，有一种标记是你无法击败的：内在的标记。”

想象

我们无法想象自己的结局。尝试想象死亡的感觉。你不能，真的不能。你可能会想到黑暗或睡眠，这些你在这一生中实际经历过的事情，但你的大脑对真实的事情没有任何有意义的参考点。因此，我们相信衰落和死亡是为其他人保留的事情。

如果我们在构思和接受宇宙保质期这一任务方面设计得很糟糕，我们就更不可能认识到沿途出现的较小的结局。

政治家和首席执行官尤其不擅长这一点。华盛顿是一个大型的辅助生活社区，充满了富人，他们相信世界没有他们就无法相处，也永远不需要这样做。其结果是，随着老年人不断为自己投更多的钱，繁荣从年轻人向老年人发生了灾难性的转移。正如我之前所写，我们需要更多的年龄歧视，特别是流失。

哈佛商学院教授兰贾伊·古拉蒂 (Ranjay Gulati) 最近告诉《纽约时报》 ，“大多数领导者如果听任自己的安排，将无法识别离开的正确时机。当每个人都告诉你你是对的时，你真的很难保持脚踏实地和谦虚。”

思考

这让我们回到了特朗普这个真正的坏人可能连任的可能性。拜登，一个真正正派的人，让他的自我赌上了我们所有的未来。他愿意这样做反映了人类的共同弱点。但这并不能减少它的错误或自私。他和他的家人将自己的希望/愿望置于国家的希望之上。然而，我相信他在辩论中的灾难性表现引发了一场对话和清算，这可能会在本周末导致拜登家族决定他应该退出。

为什么？大坝溃决了。辩论结束后，科技/媒体/国会/政党中最有影响力的声音（即《纽约时报》里德·霍夫曼、南卡罗来纳州众议员詹姆斯·克莱伯恩、佩洛西、奥巴马）都开始——尽可能温和地——开始建议他应该退出。就像一个意识到自己即将被抛弃而无法停止发送短信的青少年男孩或女孩一样，拜登阵营在过去 24 小时内向我发送了 8 封电子邮件，向我保证他们“会赢得胜利”。最糟糕的是，效忠者们试图在网上羞辱人们，让他们把头抬起来——“喘口气，坐下来，90 分钟并不能定义总统职位，”等等。

说真的……醒醒。这。他妈的。向上。

替代者

最有可能取代拜登的两位候选人是副总统哈里斯和加州州长纽瑟姆。没有其他人具有知名度。

在接力棒传递后一周内，任何一个人的民调支持率都会大幅上升。品牌就是差异化，与特朗普形成鲜明对比。两人都没有参与叛乱，没有被判对性虐待负有责任，也没有强迫五分之一需要终止妊娠的妇女离开自己的州。而且，最明显的是，两人都是在特朗普大学毕业并为父亲工作时出生的。

哈里斯将是最无缝的，因为从技术上讲，拜登筹集的 25 亿美元也是她的。此外，这个国家似乎终于准备好迎接一位女总统了，而且自这场灾难以来，她似乎已经找到了自己的声音。最后，尽管她没有以副总统的身份脱颖而出，但她是一位强有力的总检察长和参议员。这表明她可能更适合担任行政职务。

纽瑟姆是直接从中央铸造出来的，是在一家工厂里用来自较小候选者的零件制造的。他已经是一个（经济上）比印度、法国或英国更大的国家的总统。他是一位出色的辩论家。最后，他很性感——人们更有可能为他们想与之发生性关系的候选人投票和拉票。纽瑟姆是令特朗普感到害怕的候选人。

场景规划

情景规划并不是试图预测未来，而是想象几种可能的未来，并确定在几种未来中获得最佳结果的行动方案。而且，在我看来，大多数/所有道路都会导致拜登总统下台。民意调查显示，现状将导致特朗普获胜——以下是三种替代情景以及每种情景对拜登家族意味着什么的猜测：

1 .拜登退出，特朗普落选

拜登巩固了他作为伟大总统之一的遗产，在进入任何房间时都会受到起立鼓掌。他的余生是所有胜利圈之母。当民意调查谁应该被添加到拉什莫尔山时，他就在候选名单上。

2.拜登退出，特朗普获胜

我不认为这是一个现实的场景。或者更具体地说，我不想考虑它。 （这些是我的设想。）无论如何，如果这一切成为现实，没有人会要求拜登负责尝试做正确的事情。

3.拜登留任/获胜

这让我相信他会在未来几天退出。约瑟夫·拜登和他的家人经历了巨大的损失。很难了解一个家庭的具体动态，但可以肯定的是，他的家人非常爱他。对于他们的丈夫/父亲/兄弟来说，最糟糕的结果不会是输给特朗普——这将是第二个任期。他的生活将变成一场精心设计的舞蹈，家庭和助手试图将他从公众视野中隔离出来。当他屈服于一个无法击败的敌人时，他每天都会经历无数次私人和公开的小羞辱。 （参见上文：生物学。）

留任可能是他想要的，也是拜登家族认为他们想要的。但是，在一定距离后，他的亲人会认识到，继续参加比赛会带来两种结果：糟糕和更糟。说真的，对于我们这些照顾八十多岁父母的人来说……想象一下他的生活，如果他获胜的话，在接下来的四年半里。我不相信他的家人会让这种事发生在他身上。

我认为爱在这里获胜。

生活如此丰富，

帖子《离开的时间》首先出现在《无情/无恶意》上。

我在一个黑暗的地方。当一个骗子虐待一个老人时，我目睹了民主的崩溃。我还没有跌入谷底，所以让我们讨论一下社交媒体和年龄限制。

成瘾和影响

社交媒体的影响力和令人上瘾的潜力是前所未有的——就像一个可以装在口袋里的无底多巴袋。对于孩子来说，这会带来更大的风险。证据是压倒性的，并且已经存在了一段时间了。只是花了一点时间才意识到这些谎言是多么厚颜无耻——“我们为我们的进步感到自豪。”社交媒体可能很危险。这并不意味着它是“坏”的——它还有很多好处。但与汽车、酒精和 AK-47 类似，它对我们的生活有着复杂的影响。它带来了危险。健康社会所做的事情之一就是限制儿童获得危险产品，因为儿童缺乏安全使用危险产品的能力。然而，进入社交媒体时代二十年后，我们允许所有年龄段的人无限制地访问这种危险的、令人上瘾的产品。原因是：激励。具体来说，这些平台没有动力对其产品进行年龄限制，从而为任何限制访问的努力注入沙子。要改变结果，我们必须改变激励措施。

成人游泳

当我喝酒时，我会变得更好、更有趣、更有兴趣。我进行大量锻炼的原因之一是这样我可以继续喝酒——肌肉比脂肪更能吸收酒精。孩子们是不同的，我们长期以来一直乐于以不同的方式对待他们。 1838 年，威斯康星州禁止未经父母同意向未成年人出售酒类，到 1900 年，规定最低饮酒年龄的州法律已很普遍。有充分的理由表明，美国 21 度的酒精限量太高，但没有人会认为我们应该完全戒除有年龄限制的饮酒。

这种趋势与限制儿童接触其他事物的法律并行。宪法规定了携带武器的权利，但法院却毫不犹豫地阻止儿童获得枪支，尽管他们取消了对枪支拥有权的所有其他限制。如果有游说团体试图向 13 岁的孩子发放驾驶执照，我找不到。同意年龄法律将与儿童发生性行为定为犯罪；未成年人不得签订合同；我们限制他们的工作时间和条件；他们不能参军或担任陪审团成员，也不能投票。 （我们可能需要重新考虑最后一个。）这些都不是微不足道的事情。相反，我们将儿童排除在外或严重限制他们参与社会的许多核心活动。

与 Dawg 共度深夜

我唯一一次出现在深夜电视节目中是吉米·法伦 (Jimmy Fallon) 嘲笑我时播放的CNN 视频片段，其中我说“我宁愿给我 16 岁的孩子一瓶杰克和大麻，也不愿给 Instagram”。 4000 次点赞和 265,000 次观看后，美国似乎也同意了。我现在快 17 岁的儿子已经接触了这三种物质。酒精和 Instagram 让他事后感觉更糟——不确定大麻是否如此。然而，他被限制在口袋里携带一瓶杰克酒，如果他的脸被密封在烟枪上，他的父母会要求他说一句话。注意：别再给我那些孩子假期不回家的非父母或治疗师提出的废话育儿建议。

他、我们和社会限制他接触这些物质。而且，当他戒酒/戒烟时，他并没有脱离所有的社会接触和同龄人的结缔组织。当我们在他的一台设备上发现色情内容（如果你有男孩的话，你就会这么做）时，我们吓坏了。但研究很明确：当我们在他的手机上发现 Instagram/Snap/TikTok 时，我们应该更加警惕。马克·扎克伯格和谢丽尔·桑德伯格是全球经济的色情制造者。事实上，这对于色情工作者来说是不公平的。

同辈压力

年龄限制的社交媒体非常受欢迎。超过 80% 的成年人认为使用社交媒体应该需要父母的同意，近 70% 的成年人希望平台限制未成年人在社交媒体上花费的时间。

这些数字是去年秋天的数据，当时我的纽约大学同事乔纳森·海特 (Jonathan Haidt) 出版了《焦虑的一代》(The Anxious Generation) ，该书以让·特温格 (Jean Twenge)等人的工作为基础，提出了迄今为止最有力的论据，证明社交媒体正在伤害我们的孩子。海特教授回顾了我们的孩子正在经历的抑郁、自残和普遍痛苦的惊人增加以及平台辩护者提供的解释，强调了社交媒体和移动设备的双重幽灵以及它们对一代人造成的持久伤害。海特指出，不受限制地使用智能手机是“人类对自己的孩子进行的最大规模的不受控制的实验”。结果出来了。

立法机构正在做出回应。从加利福尼亚州到犹他州再到路易斯安那州，各州都通过了根据年龄限制使用社交媒体的法律。然而，如果您没有注意到这些平台的行为有任何变化，那是因为法院已经屏蔽了几乎所有平台。一个名为NetChoice的社交媒体和数字商务贸易组织很快就会起诉任何干涉其成员剥削儿童以获取最大利润的能力的国家。

“复杂的”

法官们站在平台一边，可能并不是因为他们喜欢看到抑郁的青少年被灌输美化自残的内容，或者十几岁的男孩在受到性勒索后自杀。这些法律的平台和其他反对者，例如美国公民自由联盟，提出了两个主要观点：首先，他们声称在线验证年龄过于复杂，需要收集有关用户的各种信息，并且在所有情况下都不起作用。 。其次，要求用户收集这些信息会产生言论自由、隐私和安全问题。 （这些平台还否认他们的产品对儿童有害。）

从表面上看，这些观点是正确的。在网上确认年龄比较困难，因为柜台上没有工作人员可以要求查看您的驾驶执照并参考您的面部信息。事实证明，这些平台对个人数据的处理是不计后果的。这有点像“他们如此不负责任，但我们无法采取行动”的困境。

但这些反对意见与年龄验证、儿童权利、言论自由或隐私无关。他们担心平台公司的能力。他们的论点归根结底是这样的断言：这些耗资数十亿美元的组织聚集了庞大的人力资本，掌握着神圣的技术，却无法弄清楚如何建立有效、高效、符合宪法的年龄验证系统来保护儿童。如果这听起来像废话，请相信你的直觉。

复杂性的错觉

这不是关于可能性领域的对话，而是关于有利可图的领域的对话。当你付钱让一个行业不了解某件事时，它永远不会明白。 （只要看看烟草业就无法发现与癌症的联系。）更具挑战性的是，确定某人是否小于 16 岁，或者建立一个全球实时通信网络来存储近乎无限量的文本、视频、数十亿并发用户可以在几毫秒内检索音频，并且 24/7 正常运行时间？社交媒体巨头知道你在哪里、你在做什么、你的感受如何，以及你是否有自杀意念……但他们无法计算出你的年龄。这事你编不出来。

这些平台可以设计出可靠地收集足够信息来确认用户年龄的技术，然后从服务器上删除这些信息。他们可以创建一个私人或公共实体来匿名处理年龄验证。还记得区块链吗？这不正是它应该解决的问题吗？他们可以部署人工智能，根据用户的在线行为来估计用户何时可能未成年，并向高危人群寻求年龄验证。如果设备制造商（或者只是苹果和 Alphabet 的设备操作系统双寡头）得到适当的激励，他们可以在设备本身上实现年龄验证。 （这就是 Meta 所说的它想要的，当它不反对年龄验证要求时。）或者，疯狂的想法，他们可以停止美化自杀并向每个人推销色情内容。

扎克和其他轴心国势力没有在他们的平台上建立年龄验证的原因是，这会减少他们的利润（因为他们会向孩子们提供更少的广告），这会压低他们的股价，而上市公司首席执行官的工作是来提高股价。句号，句号，战略计划结束。只要青少年自杀和抑郁症的不良公关对股价造成的负面影响小于通过对这些青少年进行无限制的算法操纵而获得的增量广告收入的积极影响，理性的、股东驱动的做法就是对抗年龄验证要求。

翻转脚本

如果我们希望平台让他们的产品对儿童来说是安全的，我们需要改变激励措施——迫使他们承担损害的成本。用经济学家的话说，将外部性内部化。三种力量足以做到这一点：市场、原告律师和政府。市场的解决方案是让消费者决定他们是否愿意被剥削和操纵。我所说的消费者是指“青少年”。这种方法的一大缺点是青少年都是白痴。我这里有证据，因为我养了两只，以前是一只。作为他们的父亲，我的工作就是成为他们的前额皮质，直到它出现为止。我星期四告诉儿子今天是星期四，他不同意。

下一个方法是让平台为所欲为，但如果他们伤害了某人，就让那个人起诉他们要求赔偿。这就是我们在几乎所有情况下监管产品安全的方式。你的汽车安全气囊是否有爆炸碎片击中你的脖子？ 高田苏。滑石粉会致癌吗？苏强生。你的手机有没有烧伤你腿上的皮肤？告三星。人们不喜欢原告律师，但诉讼是更多产品不会致癌或烫伤的一个重要原因。然而，没有人能够成功起诉社交媒体平台，因为一项已有 28 年历史的法律（称为“第 230 条”）为社交媒体平台提供了针对诉讼的全面保护。

我之前写过关于限制第 230 条的必要性的文章，每当我这样做时，言论自由绝对主义者的僵尸末日就会被释放。然而，这一主张保持不变：如果社交媒体平台认为他们已经采取了一切合理措施来保护儿童免受其产品的危险，那么就让他们在法庭上证明这一点。或者，更好的是，让对烟草/石棉型诉讼侵吞他们的利润的恐惧促使他们对他们的产品进行年龄限制。

最后，政府可以追查其产品损害消费者的公司。联邦贸易委员会因侵犯隐私而对 Meta 处以 50 亿美元的罚款，但没有明显效果。这是完美的，只是少了一个 0。对于这些公司来说，50 亿美元是一种麻烦，而不是一种威慑。参议院目前有一项法案，即《 儿童在线安全法案》 ，该法案将赋予联邦贸易委员会新的权力，以追查未能为儿童建立护栏的平台。这并非没有风险——一些右翼团体支持它，因为他们认为它可以用来压制 LGBT 内容或父权制认为不受欢迎的任何其他内容。但我对国会完善法律的能力更有信心，而不是对社交平台在没有法律的情况下进行变革的意愿更有信心。

除非我们改变激励措施并将这些平台的成本归咎于平台本身，否则它们不会改变。试图设计年龄限制系统或为平台制定详细政策的立法者正在玩傻瓜游戏。社交媒体公司可以在每一项立法中找出漏洞，资助无休无止的诉讼，并部署他们的游说大军和人造隔热罩（ Lean In ），同时让他们的系统变得更加容易上瘾和剥削。

或者也许我们错了，我们应该让我们的孩子喝酒、开车，并在 12 岁时参军。割腕后，幸存者通常会纹身来遮盖伤疤。也许青少年应该跳过社交媒体，只去纹身。我警告过你……黑暗。

生活如此丰富，

人工智能自助洗衣店

我在戛纳，宿醉的时候，我去了雅虎海滩，看了烟鬼乐队。戛纳是我在二三十岁时想要的一切，但却无法进入，因为我他妈的一直在工作，没有钱，也没有影响力。我想晚一点比较好。无论如何，今年戛纳广告大会最大的两个故事将是：

1. Musk/Yaccarino 的道歉巡演，与 Milli Vanilli 出现在 Spotify Beach 相比，这次巡演的反响稍冷一些。

“不，埃隆，真的，你可以去操你自己了。” –广告社区

2. 我的朋友 Michael Kassan 在露台上主持他的新公司 3C 的启动晚宴，俯瞰着他以前的公司 MediaLink 的派对。专业提示：有卵巢的首席执行官不会做这种事。 “鸡巴”动作的定义。我昨天在与迈克尔的小组讨论中（逐字）说了这一点，他回答说：“你的意思是，这是一个大动作。”

但。一、离题。

视觉事物

最好的创始人阐明了未来的愿景，并将公司的商业模式置于其核心。这与好莱坞没有什么不同——场景和服装在变化，但乌托邦/反乌托邦未来的承诺是不变的。顺便说一句，最能描述我们世界的标题是“平均而言，今天全球情况略有好转”。但这是令人厌恶的。具有讽刺意味的是，热门电影趋势似乎是关于商业的传记片，特别是关于成功产品的传记片。工作室高管最近批准了有关黑莓、俄罗斯方块、Air Jordan 的电影，大概在食用食品之后，还有辛辣的奇多和果馅饼。随着一切的金融化（首席执行官们纷纷签名乳房）成为七级飓风，预计有关人工智能超级恶棍的电影将会出现猛烈冲击。

在最新的《碟中谍》系列（航位推测第一部分）中，反派是一个有感知力的人工智能实体，名为……等等……“实体”。我自己正在制作一部电影，考虑到我的好莱坞职业生涯，它很快就会在影院上映。或许。

人工智能重写

在美国，金钱就是相关性——而现在世界上最相关的事情就是一家设计 GPU 的公司。英伟达的市值增长创历史新高（仅去年一年就达到了 2 万亿美元），短暂成为世界上最有价值的公司，因为它的芯片是人工智能革命的真正核心。不需要讲故事。我很欣赏 NVDA 的人来到戛纳，不像 GOOG/META 那样，先用手指抚摸媒体高管的头发，然后朝他们的脸开枪。我最喜欢的戛纳时刻：谢丽尔 2013 年的签名售书活动，吸引了数百名女性高管，尽管她的公司让数百万少女感到沮丧。

回到英伟达。想一想：一家公司在 12 个月内增加了全球汽车工业的价值和瑞典的 GDP。 OpenAI 及其甜心爸爸微软也同样受益。但少数企业无法满足投资者对人工智能故事的渴望。 CNBC 每年都会评选出 50 家最具颠覆性公司，2024 年榜单上三分之二的公司“将人工智能描述为对其业务‘至关重要’”。这句话中的关键词是“描述”。每一位能拼出“AI”（即所有人）的通讯主管和首席执行官都认为人工智能是他们公司故事的主角。然而，与《权力的游戏》类似，许多男主角和女主角都无法进入第二季。

这让我想到了坦帕斯。我的意思是……Tempus AI 。

Tempus 是一家基因组测试和数据公司。医生从患者身上采集血液或组织样本，并将其送到 Tempus 实验室，然后 Tempus 发回有关在这些样本中发现的基因的信息。除了测试之外，Tempus 还将其收集的数据授权给制药公司，制药公司使用这些数据来开发药物。 Tempus 专攻癌症，这是一项伟大的事业，因为抗击癌症是一件崇高的事情。人工智能、医疗保健、癌症……迪斯科。我给首席执行官发了电子邮件——我（有点）认识他；给我的印象是一个令人印象深刻的人——并问我是否可以投资。他说他们只让机构投资（有道理）。然而，我仍然感兴趣，所以我进一步了解了该公司（阅读：我要求我的团队调查该公司），以下是我们的发现：

从赚钱的意义上来说，这并不是一个伟大的生意。 Tempus不赚钱，它烧钱。自2015年成立以来，该公司已筹集了15亿美元的风险资金，并且几乎全部花光。根据其 IPO 文件，截至 3 月 31 日，Tempus 的银行存款还剩 8000 万美元。而且它每周烧钱 800 万美元，这表明它上周将耗尽现金。该公司于 4 月底从软银那里额外筹集了 2 亿美元，否则它可能无法参加 IPO。我想知道中央情报局什么时候会在莫斯科安插软银、查马斯·帕利哈皮蒂亚和凯西·伍德来削弱俄罗斯经济。

腾邦AI跌跌撞撞地冲过IPO终点线，掉进了一堆钱里。它的定价为 37 美元，开盘价为 40 美元，最高触及 44 美元，最后收于 38 美元，一天交易后，该公司的市值达到 60 亿美元。一次可观的 IPO 冲击，以及4.11 亿美元的支票（又名烧钱的一年）。该估值低于 Tempus 80 亿美元的私募市场估值，但 11 倍的收入倍数仍高于其竞争对手，例如 Guardant 和 NeoGenomics，其交易价格分别为 6 倍和 2.7 倍。 （Guardant 在 IPO 前三天通过专利诉讼欢迎 Tempus 进入公开市场。见上文：迪克举动。）

一家在竞争激烈的市场中面临专利诉讼的亏损企业，其前任公司Groupon在烧掉了 15 亿美元投资者资金后，其股价仅为 IPO 估值的 6%，其经营者是如何获得近乎两倍的市盈率的？它最有价值的竞争对手？答：当人们手头有现金时，永远不要低估市场提供产品/故事的能力。在这种情况下，很可能（再次）是投资者受到了打击。

Tempus 在其 IPO 文件中提及 AI 228 次，去年甚至将这些字母添加到其名称末尾。值得注意的是，该公司于 2021 年首次申请 IPO，当时提及人工智能78 次。 AI炒作指的是Tempus凳子的第三条腿，即其“AI应用”产品线。 Tempus 的想法是，将其实验室测试与对患者整个记录（其他测试结果、医生笔记、家族史、药物治疗等）的全面审查结合起来，并为患者护理提供建议。人工智能医生。这听起来很神奇，但也是科幻（即奇幻）。确实如此，因为人工智能应用部门目前占公司收入的 2%。腾邦还没有时间在其标志中添加“AI”，其网站上唯一包含新名称的部分是投资者关系部分。 S-1 读起来就像法学硕士撰写的风险投资宣传材料，并带有以下提示：“为 IPO 路演制作 30 分钟的幻灯片演示，将我们定位为一家人工智能公司。”第二个提示：“更多牛铃”，如果牛铃是人工智能的话。

旋转周期

我无法决定是否应该批评 Tempus 还是赞扬它。市场想要人工智能公司，腾邦想要市场资本，它通过人工智能洗盘来配对交易。每个人都在这样做，而该公司吸引廉价资本的能力可能会提供类固醇，将其从卡尔刘易斯转向本约翰逊。 Tempus AI 并不是第一家玩名字游戏的公司：C3.ai 最初的名称是“C3”，喝了一杯咖啡后的名称是“C3 Energy”，然后以“C3 Energy”的身份加入了“物联网”潮流。 C3IoT”，然后以 C3.ai 的名称上市。

在英国，国内最大的能源公司 Octopus 自 2001 年以来估值已上涨近 2 倍，其首席执行官不停地谈论人工智能。星巴克正在利用人工智能“ 培育人类精神”，凯洛格授予“ MBAi ”商学院学位。在我的在线教育初创公司Section中，我们提供了一个AI学院，但我们还没有将名称更改为Section.ai。 （尽管 GoDaddy 的售价仅为798,888 美元……对于估值上涨 2 倍来说，这个价格很小。）甚至真正的洗衣机也参与其中：LG 在 2020 年推出了一款人工智能驱动的洗衣机。高盛银行家为每个人带来了一台洗衣机路演。

我们以前来过这里，而且循环总是轮流发生。最近的话题是加密货币，以及一切事物的NFT 化。 20 世纪 90 年代末的互联网繁荣催生了包括 DrKoop.com 在内的企业的诞生，该网站是前卫生局局长 C. Everett Koop的网站，该网站在纳斯达克 IPO 中股价上涨了 38%，然后于 2001 年破产。

有一些迹象表明，人工智能洗涤的黄金时代正在放缓，即将结束。监管机构正在关注。美国证券交易委员会对两名投资顾问处以六​​位数的罚款，原因是他们谎称在财务预测中使用了人工智能。该机构的执法负责人明确表示，这是对上市公司的警告：“声称采用人工智能的公开发行人也必须对可能对个人投资决策产生重大影响的类似错误陈述保持警惕。”

美国证券交易委员会还对已停业的招聘公司 Joonko 提出欺诈指控，该公司声称使用人工智能来识别不同的求职者，但去年其创始人被揭露夸大其数字并编造虚假推荐后，该公司就熄火了。联邦贸易委员会希望公司知道它正在关注他们的人工智能声明，而 FDA 正在研究规范人工智能模型在医疗保健中的使用。市场上最受欢迎的公民警长兴登堡研究中心 (Hindenburg Research) 最近将卖空枪口指向了 Equinix， 指责这家数据中心提供商兜售“人工智能白日梦”。

Tempus AI 的 IPO 可能是人工智能清洗周期结束的最新信号，因为其温和的、预先策划的流行已经消失。 C3.ai 的股价已较 2021 年 IPO 后高点下跌 80%。

空气干燥

人工智能机会和人工智能清洗之间的界限既不明确也不固定。当然，对于异常者来说这是显而易见的——英伟达将继续注册人工智能的上行动力，而那些声称使用人工智能来选股的可疑经纪人则不会。但对于大多数公司来说，只有事后才能清楚地认识到这一点。讽刺的是，一年前的大新闻是如何检测某人是否在使用人工智能（ 新闻报道、 学生论文、律师）。今天，我们试图辨别一家公司是否没有使用人工智能。

生活如此丰富，

  • 施乐帕克研究中心

  • 棕榈

总市值：210 亿美元。这只是因为黑莓和诺基亚以某种方式仍然存在。 （施乐于 2023 年将 PARC 捐赠给了一家非营利组织，其估值为1.32 亿美元。）利用已故者的创新成果的公司中，只有微软、苹果、谷歌和 Meta 等四家公司的市值超过 7 万亿美元。第二只老鼠经常得到奶酪。特斯拉没有发明消费电动汽车（通用汽车），维萨没有发明信用卡（大来俱乐部），麦当劳没有发明快餐汉堡包（白色城堡），可口可乐没有发明苏打水（博士） 。 胡椒）。有一家公司的市值比所有五家公司的总和还要大——苹果公司是第二只像蓝鲸那么大的老鼠。

I-品牌

“AI”在 2024 年经历了类似于最高法院、Twitter 和精英大学所遭受的品牌资产内爆。人工智能品牌的承诺是，它要么拯救我们，要么杀死我们所有人。它两者都没有做到。人工智能节省的时间大部分都被媒体对微软人工智能（有些人称之为 OpenAI）管理（或缺乏管理）戏剧性的令人窒息的报道所消耗。该品牌是资本主义和 Bravo 频道的后代。股东价值的惊人增长与知识产权盗窃、幻觉和不断的灾难交织在一起。这就好像鲁珀特·默多克第六次与天网结婚一样。我对前一句话感到特别自豪。苹果放弃 AI 品牌并选择 Apple Intelligence，是 2024 年最好的品牌举措。最差的呢？答：在霞多丽推动的倒挂星条旗的决定和美国校园里有用的白痴的僵尸启示之间犹豫不决。

苹果情报

“Apple Intelligence”不仅仅是一个伟大的品牌举措，更是一个伟大的品牌举措。它概括了公司的战略。采取其他地方发明的东西；使其对消费者更加友好、更易于使用、更可靠；融入世界一流的工业设计；并打印数十亿。人工智能是为技术兄弟和数据科学家服务的。 Apple Intelligence 是我们其他人的人工智能。精明。

过去 18 个月里，科技媒体一直在告诉我们苹果在人工智能方面落后了。下一次报告其竞争对手在人工智能方面的失误。这就是重点。苹果总是落后。 Apple 是一家极具创造力的公司——其 300 亿美元的研发预算每年产生 2,000 多项专利。但它主要是改进而不是发明：更精确地切割白色纸板箱以交付新设备的方法；新型胶水可将手机中的玻璃层和塑料层粘合在一起。对于鼠标、数字音乐和多点触控屏幕等大东西，它可以让其他人首先穿越内华达山脉。

苹果究竟在什么方面“落后”了？ 《经济学人》预计，到 2024 年，人工智能将为人工智能“领导者”Alphabet、亚马逊和微软带来 200 亿美元的收入，占其总收入的 2%。苹果仅通过 Airpods 就赚取了近 200 亿美元。想一想——所有这些炒作和增加的股东价值，可与德国的 GDP 相媲美，而人工智能行业（到目前为止）与 Airpods 的规模相同。媒体告诉我们，由于其保密性，苹果对于尖端人工智能研究人员而言并不是一个有吸引力的雇主。但该公司满足于让人工智能科学家在其他地方工作并自由地发布他们的作品和交流想法。

Siri，但更好

当苹果确实试图走在前沿时，它证实了其较慢方法的优点。当 2011 年推出 Siri（使用其收购的技术）时，塞缪尔·杰克逊 (Samuel L. Jackson)向我们介绍了科幻小说中一直向我们承诺的数字助理。即使在今天，Siri 也没有像 2011 年承诺的那样好用。我只是问了她杰克逊在 2011 年问过的同样的问题——“给我找一家卖有机蘑菇做意大利调味饭的商店”——她给了我一份 UPS 商店的清单。 Siri 是苹果公司最明显的失败，甚至比 Vision Pro 还要严重——这款耳机只是一个余兴节目，是蒂姆·库克购买的一份保险，以防有关耳机的谎言（据猜测）是正确的。苹果花了不少钱换沙发，以防扎克了解硬件。他没有。然而，Siri 应该是苹果最重要产品的核心。苹果拥有品牌资产和资本来吸收此类错误，但失误表明，先行并不是制胜策略。

Alexa 和 Google Assistant 比 Siri 更好，但还不够好。他们也出来得太早，陷入了内华达山脉的泥潭，被迫互相吃掉。太多了？如果 Apple Intelligence 兑现了本周做出的承诺，那么这个版本的 Siri 将是苹果应该等待推出的产品。与人工智能委员会的其他成员相比，苹果已经学会了少做承诺，他们小声地告诉我们他们对人工智能有多么担忧。这是令人讨厌的谦虚自夸。反苹果人群抱怨说，Android 已经拥有了苹果的许多新功能。如果你有合适的手机并且能够驾驭复杂的生态系统，那么确实如此。它有“人工智能”。

Apple Intelligence 与 ChatGPT 的集成也优雅地消除了生存威胁。很少有公司能够引起消费者的共鸣并拥有廉价资金来推出手持电话。据报道，OpenAI 正计划与前苹果设计师 Jony Ive 一起开发一款人工智能手机。但是，当您可以在 iPhone 上安装 ChatGPT 时，为什么还要购买 ChatGPT 手机呢？

卷心菜

在苹果全球开发者大会当天，Apple Intelligence 推出后，该股下跌了 2%。然而，就像一个聪明的笑话一样，需要一段时间才能吸收真正的洞察力。

从股东的角度来看，Apple Intelligence 已将公司定位为（再次）创造历史上（第二）最赚钱的授权交易。苹果的大部分股东价值并非来自微软或谷歌的竞争，而是因此而来。具体来说，苹果公司作为地球上十亿最富裕居民的看门人，有能力让两者相互对抗。 Alphabet 每年向苹果支付 200 亿美元，让谷歌成为默认搜索引擎，并获得进入全球顶级俱乐部的 VIP 权限。其中可能有 198 亿美元达到底线。以市盈率为 32 倍计算，Alphabet 交易占苹果市值的 20%。纳入 OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 将使企业对 MSFT/OpenAI 和 Alphabet 进行攻击并骚扰它们，因为它们将被迫支付数十亿美元才能直接接触苹果用户。 据报道，苹果公司在推出时将免费开放 ChatGPT ，但不要指望这种情况会持续下去，因为苹果公司可能会设立一个收费站，而且它肯定会从通过 iPhone 购买的高级聊天机器人订阅中收取通常的分成。市场已经明白了这一点，在接下来的两个交易日里，苹果公司的市值增加了 3000 亿美元。苹果情报，无论用什么名字，都是这十年苹果公司的垄断税。

情境智能

自 ChatGPT 推出以来，“生成式人工智能”一直是科技领域的缓和流行语，但还有更强大的东西：情境人工智能。我不需要人工智能来了解有关冰岛历史或鼻窦药物的一切。我需要它来了解我。我的 iPhone 上最令人印象深刻的人工智能功能是“记忆”。我不知道它是如何或何时添加的，但它很强大。我突然收到通知——“你有了新的记忆”——还有一张我的孩子们上学第一天的剪裁图像，较小的孩子紧贴着他的母亲，然后又进入了另一张大孩子不舒服的图像他。一切都准备好了，音乐将我大儿子的性情从冷漠变成了可爱。但我离题了。我使用人工智能进行头脑风暴和研究；到目前为止，这对我的生活的影响远不及更轻松地搜索照片的能力——苹果智能将增强这一功能。适时的记忆以一种好的方式让我陷入了巧克力混乱。 GPT-5 中的任何参数都不会生成该结果。

融入苹果生态系统是苹果智能公告的主题，为人工智能提供我们的电子邮件和消息、日历、浏览器历史记录的背景——我们设备上已有的整个信息库。发布后，Apple Intelligence 将开始接触我们设备之外的第三方应用程序和服务。这才是真正的奶酪所在——“斯科特，你的肩膀疼痛怎么样？要我帮你预约物理治疗师吗？”

设计很重要，苹果的人工智能功能将反映这一点。但苹果在其发展的现阶段的更大优势不是设计、技术或分销，尽管它们都是同类中最好的。它的优势在于，对于地球上最富有的十亿人来说，iPhone 是他们早上看到的第一个设备，也是他们睡觉前的最后一个设备，而且全天与他们的距离永远不会超过几英尺。我所做的一切都在我的手机上。获得我可自由支配支出的法学硕士将是获得我的法学硕士。这意味着它必须存在于我的 iPhone 上。

减少负面影响

第二种鼠标策略的另一个优点是，当你失败时，它的成本要低得多。出口伤口干净且愈合很快。 Meta 花费了460 亿美元，将扎克伯格的 VR 幻觉塞进了装有 Nike Fuelband 的同一个抽屉。苹果在虚拟世界上更便宜的看涨期权可能会在几年内悄然消失，而不会造成持久损害。在创新驱动的行业中，失败的方式几乎与成功的方式同样重要。我预测Vision Pro 推出时会失败，但我没有出售苹果股票。

2025年

明年可能是人工智能领域真正的赢家和输家开始出现的一年。我们还处于Netscape阶段，技术本身就是创新。由于我们的政府在过去 40 年里一直在反垄断的转变上沉睡，通常的大型科技巨头将争夺人工智能霸主地位，而苹果则握有强手。不仅因为它的第二鼠标策略，还得益于它的垂直整合。采用轻资产模式可以赚很多钱——参见 Airbnb、Shein、Nvidia，在另一篇文章中对此有更多了解——但苹果相反的做法有其优势。

Apple Intelligence 需要大量计算能力才能在设备上运行法学硕士，但这对其上下文感知、速度和可靠性至关重要。当这些功能在今年晚些时候推出时，它们只会在最新的 Apple 设备上发挥最大作用，从而为大约 10 亿旧版本的用户提供升级的理由。然后它们将适用于未来的每一款 iPhone、iPad 和 Mac。这增强了相对于 Alphabet 的优势，后者无法确保每部 Android 手机都具备运行 Gemini Nano（相当于 Apple Intelligence 的 Android LLM）所需的硬件，甚至无法确保访问更新的操作系统。长期以来，Android 的致命弱点就是这种碎片化——你在主题演讲中看到的 Pixel 上运行的内容需要数年时间才能渗透到大多数 Android 用户实际拥有的手机上。

未来的回忆

我花了大量的财富在好地方买房子。我们的目标是住在我的儿子们以及他们收集的人会来拜访我的地方。关于死亡，我想了很多。它给了我力量/勇气，让我生活得更响亮、更不那么恐惧。当屁股癌症来临时，我计划去一个美丽的地方，周围都是非常想念我的人，一大堆海洛因，还有汤姆·佩蒂，他的八十年代最好的朋友也会加入其中。此外，在 Apple Memories 的帮助下，我计划重新开始我的生活。这就是技术的真正承诺：不是用假阳具探索新世界，也不是降低客户服务成本；而是为了节省人们的时间，以便他们可以与亲人共度更多时光……并感觉与他们更亲近。科技的承诺不是人工智能，而是与生俱来的亲密感。

纵观人类历史，如果我们获得的资源超出了我们的需要，我们就会保留多余的资源，以便在经济困难时期生存。拥有多余的物品也象征着财富和作为伴侣的渴望，而关键的仪式往往取决于贵重物品的安全存放。我们储存农作物的能力是发展农业经济的关键。保存了几个世纪的手工制品让我们感觉与上帝更亲近——最美丽的物品被保存在礼拜堂里，然后它们就成为了有价值的储藏室。工业时代和随之而来的大规模生产创造了所有好问题的根源，但很快就变成了一个问题：过剩。我们的直觉没有跟上生产力或处理能力的步伐。我们不仅贪吃，还囤积。

发射失败

当整个经济和社会都在一个激励因素下运行时，要在年轻人的混乱氛围中提升并满足我们对事物和体验的渴望是非常具有挑战性的：更多。这是陈词滥调，但却是事实：第一个百万（即发射）是最困难和最危险的。猎鹰 9 号重型火箭飞行数千英里，在第一英里就燃烧了三分之一的推进剂。大多数到达轨道的人都会让引擎咆哮。他们渴望从千万富翁到亿万富翁，再到贝佐斯。而且，一旦你进入太空，事情就会变得更容易——轻轻一推/用力就能让你移动数千英里而不是英尺。资本主义有利于资本，因此很快就会变得不可抗拒。由于无法关闭助推器，许多超级富豪变成了囤积者，除了积累更多之外，没有其他目的而获得更多。

呼气

我的父亲和母亲与经济焦虑的距离从来不超过两度。是的，我妈妈对我爸爸为了另一个女人而离开她感到失望，但她对经济的恐惧更严重。她将如何独自照顾我和她自己？我从来没有意识到，大多数人也永远不会意识到，在重担解除之前，我们背负着多少经济焦虑。经济安全带来了我没有预料到的其他东西：多年的喘息。

当我妈妈接受化疗时，我无力承担家庭护士的费用，当我后来失去了生意时——就在我大儿子出生的同一个月——我感到了强烈的失败感。回想起那些时刻，我仍然感到后背隐隐作痛。一个公司（NVDA）可以在一个日历月内将澳大利亚的国内生产总值添加到一个经济体中，但同时也有大量人口生活在这种深深的焦虑之中，这是不可接受的，句号。美国亿万富翁的激增与绝望死亡的比例是多少？我的直觉告诉我，当任何体面的社会都要求这些群体的规模呈负相关时，这是积极的。

这种焦虑在其他不太富裕的国家基本上不存在。现任者会找借口说这些国家依赖石油或者更加同质化。专业提示：这是一个胡扯的故事，旨在掩盖六个人控制的财富比美国下半部分人还要多，而且平均税率为 6%，这是多么令人愤慨。此外，我们生产的石油比世界上任何国家都多。但我离题了。

花费

蔑视支出是一种时尚，但支出通常会在影响最大的时候将资金重新投入经济，从而产生工资和机会。我不理解那些有钱却不花钱的人。社交为服务员、调酒师和服务员创造了就业机会。我在大学里做过的所有工作：在 Westwood Marquis、Chart House 餐厅或 Monty's Steakhouse（问问你的父母，他们是否住在九十年代的西洛杉矶）度过的一个忙碌的夜晚可能会改变我那周的生活。制造新车或翻新度假屋需要数百人的努力。这并不是涓滴经济学的论据——我们不需要把更多的钱放进富人的口袋里。但他们拥有的钱最好花在经济上，而不是囤积在市场上。消费者支出占美国经济活动的三分之二，收入最高的五分之一家庭的支出占其中的近一半。 100 万美元的娱乐支出直接支持 6.5 个工作岗位，另外间接支持 22.5 个工作岗位。

真花属

现代研究证实了亚里士多德的观点。长期、可持续的幸福并非来自财富，而是来自与他人的关系。财富的真正礼物是摆脱经济焦虑，这种焦虑几乎会给所有关系带来压力。经济上的不安全感会剥夺我们的幸福感，但财富的回报却会递减。拥有 1000 万美元资产的人所享有的生活方式和娱乐机会与拥有 1 亿美元资产的人所享有的生活方式和娱乐机会略有不同。从 1 亿美元到 10 亿美元可能是一次洗牌。您可以购买一支足球队，但您还需要私人保安。我认识许多百万富翁和一些亿万富翁，但我没有看到任何科学或轶事证据表明，除了缓解经济焦虑以及与家人一起做美好事情的能力之外，财富还能带来幸福感的增量增加。如果超过一定数额就没有任何好处，而且几乎一切都可以支持低收入家庭……那么对于最高收入水平来说，高度累进的税收政策不是理所当然的吗？

把它放弃

事实证明，一种能够产生回报和幸福感的支出形式就是给予。你在别人身上花的钱越多，你的幸福感就会增加得越多。事实上，给予他人既能带来短暂的快乐，又能带来长期的幸福，这一点已在众多研究中得到证实：核磁共振扫描显示，向食物银行捐钱会点亮我们大脑中对可卡因做出反应的相同快乐中枢。那些对陌生人做了一些小善举的人会在几周后感到更加快乐。志愿服务与更强的幸福感相关。事实证明，捐钱与赚更多钱与幸福感有着相似的相关性。总之，如果/当你达到了你的数字（好问题），你为什么不花掉或放弃你的增量财富呢？为什么我们不追求真正的财富——幸福、归属感、成为比我们更伟大的事物的一部分呢？

美德与信号

任何慈善努力可能都比没有好，但并非所有的捐赠都是平等的。技术和金融兄弟的公关宣传太多，而实际捐赠却不够。

证据 A：2010 年，雄心勃勃的纽瓦克市长科里·布克 (Cory Booker) 希望筹集2 亿美元来修复纽瓦克腐败且支离破碎的公立学校系统。他说服马克·扎克伯格 (Mark Zuckerberg) 承诺投入 1 亿美元，并说服投资者比尔·阿克曼 (Bill Ackman) 追加 2500 万美元。然后他、扎克和州长克里斯·克里斯蒂都在奥普拉节目中宣布了他们的宏伟计划。节目播出后，扎克又回到了压抑的青少年，让我们的话语变得粗俗，克里斯蒂成为了全职总统候选人，而布克则将注意力转移到了华盛顿特区。2亿美元消失在同样腐败和破碎的学校系统中，无影无踪。他们投资纽瓦克的学校是错误的吗？不，只是没有效果。如果没有对基础设施的持续、结构性投资，来自富人的钱往往只是甜头。

证据B：太多的亿万富翁慈善事业不是捐赠，而是12克拉的误导：洗钱以避税和维持王朝。超级富豪的捐赠中有 41%流向了私人基金会和捐助者建议的基金。这些组织向董事会成员、顾问和其他人支付报酬，相互捐赠，并且可能永远不会种一棵树或挖一口井。许多都是免税增长资金的仓库，实际上是用纳税人的钱补贴亿万富翁的投资。超级富豪将税法武器化，以囤积财富，然后通过慈善事业占据道德制高点，以掩盖所欠税款。亿万富翁每向慈善机构捐赠一美元，政府就会损失 74 美分的收入。

证据C：捐赠誓言是在您去世时捐出大部分财富的承诺。该承诺受到了很多媒体的关注。比尔·盖茨 (Bill Gates) 和沃伦·巴菲特 (Warren Buffet) 推出这一举措是为了刺激亿万富翁的捐赠额超过 10%（这一比例已成为常态）。然而，它所做的好事与其承诺和公关相比显得相形见绌。 “捐赠”不包括政治捐赠，但仅此而已，特别是允许亿万富翁长期以来使用的私人基金会来避免实际给其他人一毛钱。该承诺背后有一个组织负责协调成员之间的活动和对话，但我认为这（大部分）只是装饰门面，掩盖了不受约束的收入不平等的严重程度。盖茨和巴菲特比他们开始捐赠时更加富有；该承诺的 73 名成员在 2010 年都是亿万富翁，他们的集体财富在过去十年中增加了两倍。 “囤积誓言”不是更合适的名字吗？

她

我之前写过关于麦肯齐·斯科特 (MacKenzie Scott) 的文章，他采用了一种低调的方式来进行鼓舞人心的捐赠。她与一个小团队一起运作，通常在他们不知情的情况下悄悄审查可能的接受者，并在不附加任何条件、没有公关宣传、也没有任何要求就她不具备领​​域专业知识的问题上提出意见的情况下提供大量资助。她捐赠了近 2 美元在发表任何公开声明之前已捐赠了 140 亿美元，迄今为止已捐赠了 140 亿美元。与她同为 PNW 亿万富翁的梅琳达·弗伦奇·盖茨 (Melinda French Gates) 上个月离开了盖茨基金会，将她的慈善事业重点放在为妇女和家庭服务的组织上，她已经宣布向数十个组织捐赠 10 亿美元的礼物。

这里的内容远不止表面上看到的那样。进化理论表明，亲缘选择和包容性适应性对于女性来说更为自然，因为她们从小就变得更有同理心，更容易形成社会纽带。女性在社会中也变得更加有教养、更合作、更注重社区。前一句话是对慷慨的恰当表达。女性会产生在没有个人认可的情况下帮助他人的愿望。富裕家庭中85% 的慈善捐赠决定是由女性做出或受女性影响的。总而言之，女性付出的方式不同。更强调给予部分。

数字

大约十年前，我就达到了我的“数字”。我故意停下来，花费了大量的时间和意识来搭建脚手架，以更新/磨练我获得更多财富的本能。我决定花很多钱去体验与家人或服务，让我有更多的时间与他们和我的朋友共度时光。我的生命（按时间顺序）可能只剩下三分之一，但我打算在剩下的时间里度过我生命的 4/3。意思是，我想要一系列的体验，让我感觉与家人和朋友更亲近，并从这个七大洲椭球体中榨取尽可能多的能量。

在为了生意而骚扰地球 30 年之后，很明显，当我独自一人时，留在最美丽的地方、最具标志性的城市毫无意义。前一句话也可以形容我三十多岁的样子。就好像那十年从未发生过，因为我大部分时间都是独自一人。我在 Terra 上漫游时的另一个观察结果是，美国是最好的赚钱地点，而欧洲是最好的消费地点——这也是我们搬到伦敦的原因之一。另外，我还有100%的自征税。每年，我都会把我的支出加起来，并捐出相同数量或更多的钱。对我来说，关于给予的惊喜在于它让我感到多么阳刚。我觉得我的力量和技能正在保护和提供。

囤积者

我上面描述的囤积行为只与一小部分人口有关。更为普遍的是囤积商誉。我们每个人都拥有良好的意愿、积极的姿态和对他人的礼让等形式的财富。你会珍藏这份善意吗？在我生命的前 40 年里，我对自己的情感很吝啬，没有告诉人们他们有多么令人印象深刻，或者我有多么钦佩和关心他们。这是我们社会中真正的环境浪费：拥有资源来帮助人们自我感觉更好，而不分享这些资本。说完这句话，我要理清思绪，祝你一切顺利。我希望你快乐、繁荣。我（真的）真心祝愿你一切顺利。没有理由隐藏这种情绪。

美国及其领导的西方联盟功能失调。它的功能失调也不如任何其他社会。为什么？美国的个人主义，权利，教育，创新，资本，多样性，企业家精神和慷慨的炼金术创造了其他地方的物质，但并非如此。我花了很多时间消化数据和媒体。他们之间有一个裂痕。数据反映了一个冷淡但令人安慰的事实：您所得到的手比被告知要好。

代理你

代理是采取您选择的行动，并通过这些行动来塑造您的未来和生活的世界。除此之外，这是认识到您有能力实现这一目标。代理是人类自治和身份的基本方面。认为自己是代理商的个人更有动力，有能力和韧性。由移民组成的社会具有卓越的基因 - 它们的DNA自然可以将风险和行动倾向联系起来，并具有更好的结果。我认为，作为爸爸，我的责任之一是帮助我的儿子将好与坏的行为与结果联系起来。帮助他们发展动作和反应之间的模式识别。

专家和决策者对统计数据有恋物癖。 “ 25至34岁之间的女性酸奶的酸奶比45岁以下的男性高3倍。” “在假期周末，美国家庭最低的四分位数在沃尔玛使用借记卡，比前三名四分位数的总和更频繁。”我的职业生涯大部分时间都在研究数据集并进行广泛的概括。其中许多并不鼓励。但是，您是一个数据点……不是集合。

你不是你的队列。您没有被判刑是同龄人的平均值，种族的中位数或性别的均值。代理商从这个见解开始。在人类的群众中，统计学家在几个维度上将您是一个离群值。统计学家的眼睛看不见您可能的结果范围。统计数字是观察，而不是结论。

大派

经济繁荣的馅饼并没有均匀切成薄片。它偏向某些领域和背景，越来越多地倾向于现任者。我们的经济是赢家最多的经济。杰夫·贝佐斯（Jeff Bezos）的净资产（2000亿美元）是中位心脏病专家的100,000倍（200万美元）。贝佐斯（Bezos）是一位出色的企业家，但他比一位掌握患者的生命的医生并没有多100,000倍。尽管Bezos是主要的推动者，但亚马逊的价值创造需要150万员工的工作，其中只有少数人享有Bezos的净值1/10,000名（2000万美元）。

许多文化和经济体系都压制了代理，使人们朝着一致性促进了现有精英的利益。缺乏代理机构的零地面是校园里有用的白痴的僵尸启示录的文化。但我离题了。上周在G Markets上，我的主持人Ed Elson在他长大的英国方面提出了一个强大的观点。他的学校给出了两种成绩，一种是工作质量，另一种是为了努力。正式地，“最佳”等级是在这两个类别中都获得最高成绩。但是，这种文化奖励了其他东西：真正的最好的成绩是归功于质量和最低努力的最高分数的学生。成功应该是偶然的；努力是不朴的。前总理鲍里斯·约翰逊（Boris Johnson）对此进行了化身，这是一个不可否认的才华横溢的人，他完全致力于非努力的文化，反映在高度修剪的不满。

Over the past several decades, America has waged a covert war against the young . One front in this war is our income tax system, which favors Owners over Earners. Young people are almost all Earners, while Owners are typically older, and the tax code is a wealth-transfer vehicle for Owners to garner a greater share of our common wealth.好消息？ It can be changed … back.

普内德

If you get a paycheck, whether it's salary or freelance, and that's how you pay your bills, you're an Earner. Owners, on the other hand, might collect wage income, but their real money comes through profits from investments: stock sales and dividends, rent from property , and other income streams derived from the ownership of assets. To be an Earner is noble; you work for a living, and labor is a sacred thing. Labor is the source of food, shelter, entertainment, and every material pleasure of society. We even celebrate it with a holiday, the first Monday in September. Pro tip: If you want to celebrate Labor Day somewhere awesome, try as hard as you can to become an Owner.

Owners also get a celebratory day. It's April 15. Another pro tip: If you're ever featured in a commercial calling you a “hero,” it means you're getting fucked. The most fortunate in our society have no holiday, as they don't need one. They recognize that holidays wallpaper over the inequity faced by anybody who gets a day in their honor.

Income taxes for Earners are deceptively straightforward. Take your annual income, subtract the standard deduction ($24,000 for a married couple), make a few other calculations, and then pay a percentage of what's left to Uncle Sam. And the income tax rates for most people are low: A two-adult household making less than $100,000 per year pays 10% or less in federal income tax. Many pay much less, or none at all. Sounds reasonable, right?但有一个问题。 Several … catches.

First, for those paying “only” 10% or less of their wages in income taxes, other forms of tax are a heavier burden. At the federal level, Social Security and Medicare add almost 8%. Then all states collect taxes, and most state tax systems are “regressive.” All told, lower-income people pay a greater portion of their income in taxes than many rich people.

Sales tax, property tax, and other government revenue sources (licensing fees, permits and filing fees, and car registrations) take a larger bite out of lower-income households. In “low-tax” Florida, the most regressive state, low-income families (Earners) pay 13.2% of their income in state and local taxes, the middle class pays 9.1%, and the top 1% (Owners) pays just 2.7 %。 In fact, lower- and middle-income Florida households pay about the same in total taxes as they would in “high-tax” California. The next time you hear someone complain about low-income people who “don't pay any taxes,” remind them that income tax doesn't exist in a vacuum — low-income people often pay over 25% of their income in taxes.

There's a myth that the rich don't pay their fair share of taxes. The reality is most “rich” people — the super-earners — pay more than their fair share. A married household making more than $500,000 per year is in the top 5% of households by income and pays an effective federal income tax rate around 25%. Half a million dollars may seem like a lot, but careers that pay that well require expensive college and graduate degrees, entail long hours, offer little job security, and they're typically in high-cost-of-living locations with high state income tax — in New York or California, add another 10% on to that 25%. With other taxes, including sales tax, thetotal tax burden borne by mid-career professionals can reach 40% of their income. The baller who makes seven figures plus is often working for the government: Their (total) effective tax burden can approach 50%. Until, that is, they can make the jump to lightspeed (ie, become an Owner).

Think of building wealth as launching a rocket ship into orbit. Rockets burn 95% of their fuel to escape Earth's soupy atmosphere and incessant gravity. Once you get to orbit, you're a master of the universe — covering thousands of miles with just a touch of propulsion. Wealth is similar. The atmosphere is your expenses; the distance traveled, your income. Most of us never generate enough current income to make the jump to space and become an Owner — save enough to invest so our primary source(s) of income are passive. Investing is difficult, if not impossible at low income levels. Saving your first $100,000 is incredibly hard. The next $100,000 is tough, but you now have momentum and start to see the curvature of the Earth. Once your current income is substantially greater than your expenses, and you've deployed an army of capital that fights for you and your family in your sleep, you've made the jump. What we've done with the tax code has rendered the atmosphere thicker and gravity stronger. Go to law or medical school, or live at the office, and you'll see your (current) income increase, but you'll also lose a bigger share to taxes, and the harder it gets to save and escape the gravity of being an Earner.

轨道

Imagine if taxes worked like this: Everything you spend that's remotely related to work is deducted from your taxable income. Clothes you wear and food you eat during the work week, your car, your internet and cellphone bills, furniture and square footage where you work at home (eg, kitchen table), etc., all taken off your income before taxes. Pretty much anything you do on days you're working, deductible. All past investments in education, deductible. If you spent more than you earned, as you did in college and graduate schools, you can roll over those losses as deductions in future years. In the meantime, deduct any credit card interest you're paying. Any money you don't spend? That's not taxed until you retire and start spending it. If you give it to your kids, it's never taxed at all.

If this sounds familiar but awkward, it is. It's our tax code, through the lens of the Owner. The federal income tax code looks progressive: The highest marginal tax rate is 37%, more than 3x what the average American pays. But published tax rates are a weapon of mass distraction. They are the “rack rate” published on the door of your hotel room. Owners never pay the rack rate. They barely pay at all.

Unlike Earners' taxes, Owners' taxes are complex. As a result, determining the total tax burden of the very wealthy is difficult, but here's what we know: In 2020 the 26,000 households with an income over $10 million paid 25.5% of their reported income in federal taxes, plus 5% to 10% in state and local taxes. But as I explain below, much of the cash they receive isn't taxable income, and most of the increase in Owners' wealth is never taxed at all. The White House has estimated that the 400 wealthiest households pay an effective income tax rate of just 8.2%, and Pro Publica found that the wealthiest 25 households pay just 3.4%. We can't say for sure what percent Owners pay on average, but it's less than most of their employees pay. This complexity results in a transfer of wealth from Earners to Owners. The tax code has exploded from 400 to 4,000 pages in the past few decades. If you have GPS (advisers, loopholes for the wealthy), you want races run at night.

If the government is meant to decrease suffering and add happiness, then our current system makes no sense. Paying taxes of $5 million on $10 million in income is the difference between flying first class and flying private. Paying $15,000 on $60,000 in income might mean foregoing a second child.

Capitalism means accepting a society of winners and losers.没关系。 Wealth is a great reward for hard work, and talent is what drives us to create value. Capitalism has brought prosperity to billions over the past 150 years. The problem is the system, if left unchecked, becomes increasingly inequitable and unsustainable. We've morphed from capitalism to cronyism, rigged in favor of Owners.如何？ Three ways: calculation, timing, and collection.

计算

Amateurs focus on tax rates . Professionals zero in on the calculation of the income to which those rates apply. In the 1950s the highest federal income tax bracket was 91%. Except nobody paid it . The tax code was a mosaic of loopholes, ensuring high-income taxpayers were able to shield most of their income. Now the top rate is 37%, but while the colors and fabric have changed, the Owner's tapestry of tax avoidance still exists.

Owners receive cash from a range of sources: rent from tenants, dividends from stock, interest from loans, distributions from trusts, profits from investment partnerships, loans and lines of credit from banks, proceeds from asset sales, and more. Much of this income is shielded by pages of tax code defining what is, and is not, taxable. Owners who invest in the oil business leverage tax code provision section 263 (intangible drilling costs), section 613 (percentage depletion), section 611 (cost depletion), section 167 (geological expenses), section 199 (domestic production deduction), section 193 (tertiary injectant expenses), and section 469 (active losses). That's just one industry.

Entrepreneurs are barely visible to the Treasury standing behind the tax code. Section 1202 excludes the first $10 million received in the sale of a business, a provision that saved me millions of dollars when I sold my firm L2 several years ago. When working at the firm — earning — I was paying 40+% taxes. But when I sold the business, my tax rate on the proceeds — owning — was 17%. Even before selling, every small business owner gets an enormous shield, the power to push all manner of personal expenses through the company income statement, thus making them tax deductions for the business rather than taxable income for the Owner.

Income that's acquired by selling an asset for more than you paid for it is a capital gain, and isn't subject to ordinary income tax rates. Capital gains rates (federal) max out at 23.8% instead of 37%. That's still not the biggest loophole. Capital gains are only taxed when “realized” (typically when sold), so Owners' assets grow tax deferred (some you can depreciate as they go up in value) and their sales are timed to minimize taxes. Earners lose 20% to 50% of their gains (from sweat) every year, a massive gravitational pull. Owners enjoy cleaner propulsion: As their wealth grows, the taxes are deferred until they sell … if they ever do.

但等等，还有更多。 The biggest tax break Owners can register is dying, which resets the “basis” of their assets, so their heirs never pay taxes on the increase in value. Still, there's more. The most indefensible loophole award goes to the “ carried interest loophole ” which permits investment fund managers to pay capital gains rates on their compensation. Tax policy groups have been lobbying to close this loophole for years, and Congress nearly did it in 2022, but Senator Kyrsten Sinema took $2 million from the private equity industry (aka Owners) and saved their $14 billion loophole. It's well known that our leaders are whores. What's more surprising, and disappointing, is what cheap whores they are ($2 million for $14 billion).但我离题了。

Owners are so tax-advantaged that if they do have earned income, they often shield that from taxation as well. Donald Trump paid virtually no income taxes on the $427 million he made from The Apprentice — where he had an actual job — by offsetting that cash income with paper losses on his real estate properties (real estate is another of the most tax-advantaged industries) 。 In 2007, Jeff Bezos made $46 million in actual income, yet he paid zero dollars in federal income tax, because he was able to shield that income with paper losses as an Owner (in reality, his wealth increased $3.8 billion that year). In 2011, not only did Bezos pay no income tax again, he claimed and received a $4,000 child tax credit — a program intended to lower child poverty. If you paid federal income tax in 2011, you helped feed Jeff Bezos's kids. Don't worry, he's fine .

定时

A key advantage of control over timing is state income tax arbitrage, practiced often by company founders. Several years ago, the media discovered the phenomenon of California entrepreneurs moving to Texas and Florida, and there was a lot of jazz hands about those states' friendly business climates and youthful energy. The truth was simpler: Texas and Florida have no state income tax, and many of those founders were about to recognize enormous gains via sales of stock that had become worth billions. Elon Musk, who moved to Texas in 2020, sold millions of shares of Tesla, saving an estimated $2.5 billion in California income tax. When Washington State enacted a tax on income from asset sales, Jeff Bezos decided to spend more time with his father in Florida, which has no income tax, and sold 50 million shares of Amazon after he relocated. If taking advantage of Washington's schools, roads, and tech ecosystem to build wealth, and then declining to pay taxes back to the state sounds wrong — and a massive additional burden on middle-class taxpayers who can't peace out to Coral Gables — trust your instincts.

The best time to pay taxes is never , using the infamous “ Buy, Borrow, Die ” tax strategy. Wealthy Owners take out loans secured by assets such as company stock or real estate, and live off the loans (which are not considered taxable income) instead of selling the assets (which would incur a taxable gain). When the Owner dies, the stock goes to their heirs, who, with their “stepped up basis,” can sell enough stock tax-free to pay off the loans and start the cycle anew. This creates dynastic wealth, the lack of which used to be a key point of differentiation between Europe and the US Used to be.

收藏

All of these strategies are legal and enabled by the complexity of the tax code. But that complexity also affords Owners another means of avoidance: cheating.

Skirting taxes stems from the complexity of the tax code itself. Wealthy filers can take deductions that don't apply or classify income in inappropriate ways. And without an exhaustive analysis of the facts, there's no way for the IRS to determine what they've done. Some of the losses Trump used to offset his income from The Apprentice may have been illegal — the IRS believes he claimed hundreds of millions of losses on a Chicago real estate project twice , burying the double-dip under a mountain of tax paperwork so tall it's taken the IRS a decade to dig through it.

Owners can also choose to cheat bluntly, failing to report substantial income and making up fake expenses and losses. This was New York hotelier Leona Helmsley's strategy. Before going to prison for tax evasion, she told her housekeeper, “We don't pay taxes; only the little people pay taxes.” Offshore entities are a time-honored strategy for tax evasion. Trump's campaign manager, Paul Manafort, concealed $16.5 million in income from the IRS in foreign bank accounts.

The Treasury's analysis suggests $600 billion in owed taxes are not paid every year, equivalent to the total income taxes paid by the lowest-earning 90% of taxpayers. The avoidance is solely the domain of ownership income — 99% of the taxes owed on wages get paid. Owners can do this because Congress has starved the IRS of funding, and the agency audits fewer and fewer returns each year.

税收减免

Remedying these inequities is nowhere near as difficult as it would be to address many of the other challenges facing America. The most obvious and glaring remedy is to fund the IRS, enabling it to collect hundreds of billions in taxes owed but not paid. The Inflation Reduction Act was supposed to allocate $80 billion to the IRS over the next 10 years, but Republicans have attacked the measure, cutting $20 billion from the plan and keeping the IRS budget flat in 2024. Every $1 invested in tax enforcement targeting the wealthy returns $12 in revenue. To be clear, this isn't harassment but enforcement. Most externalities are a function of incentives, and the government has incentivized owners to be incredibly aggressive on their tax returns, as there is little chance they'll get caught. If you were on a highway with no police, would you speed?

Eliminating the special treatment given to capital gains is a simple fix that would increase tax revenue without increasing the tax burden of most Americans, reduce the incentive to cheat through misclassification, and make the tax system more fair. So would eliminating the step-up basis upon inheritance, which wipes away billions in taxes owed by the wealthiest people with little justification or social benefit. We should remove the income cap on social security tax (currently a paltry $160,000), which would help shore up the social security trust fund and make the tax code (not rates) more progressive. We should restore the highest marginal tax rate (for owners) to 40%. Biden and congressional Democrats have proposed all of these changes in recent years, but to no avail.

Since ownership carries with it some inherent tax advantages, a transaction tax would raise revenue from ownership in a fair manner. Numerous proposals, including one from Mike Bloomberg , for a 0.1% tax on securities trades and other financial transactions could raise nearly $80 billion per year, with the potential side benefit of damping high-frequency trading, which adds volatility without benefit to the markets. We should also levy a compute tax on cloud and AI services, as the wealth created by these innovations is accruing mainly to the wealthiest Owners. Compute is the new energy , and this is a chance to avoid the mistakes of fossil fuels, where we give tax breaks to Owners and stick Earners with gas taxes, among the most regressive surcharges in our system.

Finally, and most transformationally, Congress should take a chainsaw to the tax code, cutting the thousands of handouts to the ownership class that have been stuffed into it by lobbyists. Theoretically, finding the political will shouldn't be difficult, as the majority of Americans are getting screwed by lawmakers representing a small number of their fellow citizens. Ironically, the Trump tax cuts paved the way for this change — by doubling the standard deduction, Trump ensured that just 10% of taxpayers take any itemized deductions — meaning 90% of voters should support eliminating the rest of them. Still, it may be a challenge, as the most valuable asset Owners own … is Congress.

We should reinvest some of the hundreds of billions of dollars per year gained by these changes to make the system fairer for Earners (ie, the young):

  • Expand the child tax credit and the earned income tax credit and raise the floor required to pay any tax at all. (Currently it's set by the standard deduction at $14,600/$29,200 for single/married households.) That would shield more lower-income households from federal income tax and reduce the impact of regressive state and local taxes.
  • Lower the rates paid by higher-but-not-highest-income taxpayers, the professionals and entrepreneurs whose 60-hour-a-week climb up the professional ladder shouldn't be rewarded with a 45% tax burden. This will make earning the way to ownership (aka the American dream) more feasible.

爱国者

I am troubled by the trend away from patriotism, fomented by a tech-billionaire class that conflates luck with talent, shitposts America, and prosecutes an economic war on the young. But America's promise does not resonate unless it's backed by performance. We diminish what's great about America when we fail to talk about what's broken in America. Especially when the fixes are within our grasp.

In defense of shielding Owners, lobbyists and our representatives in DC argue the wealthy are our most productive citizens, can better deploy capital, and need incentives to keep innovating. There is some truth to this notion, but we aren't lowering taxes on the bulk of today's innovators, the super-earners, or on future innovators, young people. Instead, we are ensuring a failure to launch by transferring more wealth to Owners/seniors. The three legs of the tax stool are corporations, super-earners, and super-owners. Corporate taxes are at their lowest levels since 1939 and the wealthiest Americans are paying single-digit tax rates, meaning the entire funding burden of our country rests on the super-earners and the young, who'll have to survive the tsunami of debt we are aggregating to finance this inequity. This is capitalism collapsing under its own weight.

America, like any country, is a product — a mix of benefits that come at a price. America has been the best value (globally) for the better part of three centuries. Other than drugs, there is no other product so many people are willing to risk their lives to obtain. However, the value of America has diminished for super-earners and the young. Einstein defined the 20th century with the revelation that mass is a form of energy. Today's theoretical physics posits something more fundamental: Mass and energy are all information . The 21st century will be defined by the recognition that the most powerful form of energy is the manipulation of information: compute. The companies that control compute will be the most dominant businesses in history.

Energy has been the tail that wags every dog from the beginning of economies. Yet the narrative in the equity markets now is that Big Oil has passed the reins to Big Tech. It's a practical observation: The majority of the most valuable firms in 1980 and 2024 were/are in energy and tech, respectively. However, the construction of acres of data centers and the energy investments needed to power them reflect a deeper convergence. AI is accelerating Big Tech's transformation from an industry that sells computers to an industry that sells compute. And in a knowledge economy, compute is energy.

充电

Ten thousand years ago, energy was the only industry. The world ran on thew (muscle power), and food was the energy source. Settled agriculture in the fertile Middle East created surpluses, and economics emerged as the science of trading that surplus — exchanging energy. We then unlocked the energy in organic matter (wood, coal, oil), machines supplanted muscles, and the energy business became the business of powering machines. Oil's unrivaled source material for machine power has created wealthy nations out of deserts. Big Tech companies may dominate the league tables of market capitalization, but energy remains the revenue king. Six of the 10 largest firms by revenue are energy companies, and the industry generates more revenue than any other. However … tech looks more similar to energy each year.

CapEx = Moats = Profits

The energy business requires massive capital expenditures, allocated on data and faith, offering unrivaled payoffs for those who wager correctly. If the whaling industry is the origin story of venture capital, energy is the original gangster of CapEx. Investment across all energy sources will total $2.8 trillion in 2024. Fossil fuel companies, responsible for $1 trillion of that CapEx, generate $4 trillion in revenue. ExxonMobil spent $23 billion on CapEx in 2023, and made $36 billion in profit. The investments are chunky: The UK's newest nuclear plant , under construction in Somerset, is projected to cost $57 billion. Planning the 20th century energy's mega-projects required the development of a new science of forecasting, Shell's famous “ scenario planning ” process. Side note: Scenario planning is not predicting the future, but determining which decisions will register the best outcome(s) across several possible futures.

Now Big Tech is flexing its own thew. In 2024, the tech giants will spend the GDP of Finland ($300 billion, give or take), mainly on data centers — the modern equivalent of oilfield development. Alphabet spent $12 billion in the last quarter alone, up 90% year over year, Microsoft spent $14 billion, up 79%, and Amazon $14 billion. Tech does not match global energy investment yet, but individually, Alphabet, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft will spend more in CapEx this year than ExxonMobil, Chevron, or Saudi Aramco. Meta operates 18 data centers that cover the same area as 19 Disneylands . The Core in Las Vegas, one of the world's largest data centers, has its own hype video . (About 1 minute in, it gets … impressive.)

Big Tech's profits are also historic, and growing. Last week, Alphabet added $200 billion in market cap (to reach $2 trillion) after beating profit estimates by 25%, and Apple also added $200 billion after an earnings beat and announcing a $110 billion share buyback. Both generated more net income than ExxonMobil in 2023, as did Microsoft.

More, I Want More

Energy companies can justify these investments because our imagination for uses of energy is limitless. The iron law of big(ger) energy: The more we generate, the more we use. There's no such thing as too much energy. Energy is the antithesis of GLP-1 drugs. With energy, the more we consume , the hungrier we get.

Energy = Prosperity

Wealth and energy consumption are correlated. It's not just power for profligate lifestyles, but productive power: light, cooking and storing food, communications networks, building, transport. Academic estimates of optimal per capita energy consumption only trend up. No number of energy-efficient microwaves and double-paned windows can counter the consumption of billions moving into the middle class: Global energy consumption is projected to increase 44% by 2050 .

Tech's appetite is also insatiable. Tech's Iron Rule is Moore's Law: Processing power doubles every two years. Nitpicking about the technical details aside, the principle has held true since 1965. “How will we use this power?” Queried nobody, ever. Intel, a client of my first firm, Prophet, impressed on us its singular strategic vision. They invested massive CapEx in fabrication plants for chips they hadn't invented for applications they hadn't imagined. In sum, “ If we build it, they will come. ” Nobody needed a faster chip until Apple showed the world a graphical user interface, until Netscape browsed the Web, until God (Google) began responding to any prayer/query with millions of answers, or until a new god (ChatGPT) responded to your prayer with a single answer. Intel stumbled with the transition to mobile, but the paradigm hasn't changed. There's no such thing as too much compute.

The New New Energy

Big Tech isn't just similar to the energy business, it is the new energy business. AI's growing power requirements make this concrete. AI compute requirements are doubling every 100 days, dramatically countervailing the gains in efficiency that every AI evangelist boasts about after vomiting that it will save/destroy humanity. Training the trillion-plus-parameter models being stewed in a medium-size city (San Francisco) requires the energy consumption of a small country. One ChatGPT request requires 10 times the energy of a Google search. In five years, the incremental energy demand of AI will be equivalent to 40 million homes — more than California, Texas, Florida, and New York combined. Data centers make up 3% of total US power demand, but that's projected to triple by 2030. BTW, 2030 is the same distance into the future as the finale of Game of Thrones is in the past (2019).

To feed their data centers, tech companies are investing billions in energy production and storage. The WSJ reports Big Tech execs descended on this year's annual oil and gas conference, hunting for energy. Bill Gates was the featured speaker . Amazon, the largest corporate buyer of renewable energy, has over 500 projects operating or in development . Announcements of new data centers are accompanied by commitments to develop new wind and solar farms to provide the power.

Compute = Energy 2

The convergence of tech and energy reflects tech's transition from selling computing tools to selling compute itself. We don't buy DVD players and discs, we stream. We don't buy maps, we get directions. We don't purchase film, we capture images. Apple, the most profitable product company in history, depends on services for growth. Amazon, the Apple of retail, is a data center business that offers retail.

AI pushes this trend to everything and everyone. Search, the most profitable business in history, will be replaced by Answers. Spreadsheets and browsers will be replaced by agents. “Apps” and “programs” will be mutable, evolving code organisms raised by other agents. According to energy conference keynote speaker Bill Gates : “Agents will affect how we use software as well as how it's written. …… They'll replace word processors, spreadsheets, and other productivity apps. Businesses that are separate today — search advertising, social networking with advertising, shopping, productivity software — will become one business.” Sam Altman believes that compute will be “the currency of the future,” the world's most precious commodity.

In the 21st century, humanity has added a new page to physics, a new form of energy: compute. Just as our bodies convert the chemical energy of food into heat and mechanical energy, as solar panels convert the sun's electromagnetic energy into electricity, data centers convert electrical energy to compute, and it powers the digital economy. As with other forms of energy, compute is created by the largest companies in the world, who have staggering capital to build moats the width of the Amazon (the river). As with other forms of energy, its consumption is inextricably linked with prosperity and growth. Compute defies economic gravity — increased supply speedballs demand. The future of energy isn't renewable, but computable.

No Free Lunch

The passing of the torch from energy to tech felt good for a hot minute, because energy has gotten too in touch with its dark side. Energy firms invented the term “externality”: carbon, corruption, and capitalism as a Sith Lord. In contrast, tech felt better. Mark, Sheryl, Larry, Sergei, and Jeff were just too cute, too likable to be that evil … they even told us they would do no evil. Jeff's laughter, Sheryl leaning in, Mark hunting with a bow and arrow:

只是。他妈的。可爱的。

But then kids started harming themselves, misinformation proliferated, and our discourse became coarse. Wait … the tech lords are not better than the titans of Big Oil, they're worse. Actually, they're neither — they are the same.

Any arbitrage of one substance to another for economic gain creates emissions. Plants to beef: methane. Fossil fuels to motion: carbon. Attention to advertising: rage. To believe the great arbitrage of compute won't create extraordinary externalities is to believe that Zuckerberg/Sandberg/Brin/Bezos would prioritize the well-being of the commonwealth over their wealth. If we could go back 100 years to the beginning of the fossil fuel era, or 20 years to the start of social, what would we do differently?

Many argue that Big Tech is capitalism collapsing under its own weight. A jockey who's lost control of a thoroughbred. Regulating compute is similar to a 5-foot, 110-pound jockey mounting a Tyrannosaurus Rex. We know it will be ungainly. The bigger question is, will it be violent?

For any species to endure, it must find reward in two things: sex and conflict. The importance of the sex drive is obvious. But if we're not wired for conflict, we'll meet the same fate as if we never reproduced. Evolution is a competition for resources, and conflict is inevitable. The ecosystem isn't much concerned with who plays fair: Everything is prey to something else; conflicts arise over resources, mates, territory, and pride. We either develop a reward system that deftly chooses battles, or we'll be consumed by a species that does.

Humans are not immune. We evolved hiding in the trees while stronger, faster, and more sharply clawed creatures roamed the savanna. So we developed a robust neurological system for identifying threats, gauging their severity, and responding quickly, often before we're conscious of the threat level. But fight-or-flight wasn't enough to shepherd us out of the forests. First we had to develop our superpower: cooperation. The cocktail that's made us the apex of apex predators is cooperation on the rocks of conflict. Under threat, we become a “band of brothers,” establishing “sisterhood” to “fight the power” and form “one nation, indivisible.”

Love Thy Enemy

This system, however, is always on. It feels bad to be scared, but good to be angry. Especially good when we're surrounded by others who validate our anger and direct it toward the chosen threat. This dynamic is often referred to as “tribalism,” but that misses the point. Tribes are defined by their enemies. They help us convert danger and anxiety into brotherhood and glory. Spiritual leaders preach we should love our enemies. Evolution teaches us to love having enemies.

Rallying support under the threat of a common foe is an ancient tactic. Historical foes Athens and Sparta united to fight the Persian Empire, and Rome's rivalry with Carthage is credited with holding its fractious republic together. The US shaped a half-century of foreign policy on countering the threat of communism. Most profoundly, House Stark and the Targaryen forces allied to combat the undead.但我离题了。

We love conflict. As General Lee said at Fredericksburg : “It is well that war is so terrible, or we should grow too fond of it.” This is likely even more true today, when technology and culture have severed so many of our traditional bonds and left young people aching for connection and community. According to a recent UNICEF report , “The proportion of people willing to participate in demonstrations has increased to its highest levels since the 1990s, and the number of protests has also risen in this period.”

Know Thy Enemy

Most rivalries are harmless, but they point to a darker tradition. Because we enjoy unity in the face of threat, we seek out enemies, even if we need to manufacture them. Or we let others manufacture them for us. Scapegoating is the go-to in the demagogue's handbook.

This week, Donald Trump told Time magazine that he would consider deploying the military against immigrants inside the US, characterizing undocumented entry as “an invasion.” He claimed that “over the last three weeks, 29,000 people came in from China, and they're all fighting age, and they're mostly males.” He's right that there has been a sharp rise in the number of Chinese immigrants crossing the southern border — thousands have made it to New York, in fact. The New York Times has been documenting their arrival.

But it takes a warped perspective to see enemies among these people, sleeping in bunk beds, working the dangerous/dirty jobs American citizens don't want. I see my parents, risking everything to find a better life. Also, these new immigrants are our lifeline. They paid $500 billion in taxes in 2021 and made up 22% of all entrepreneurs. Their children are the most fiscally productive cohort in America. Without immigration, we'd be in population decline, which is the surest way to go into recession and lose influence on the global stage.

在校园

The conflict in Gaza has reverberated throughout US higher education, catching many flat-footed despite predictions that there would be disruption in academia and that DEI would begin eating its tail and turn racist. US universities have an important legacy of protest. However, there's been a troubling presence of antisemitism in these campus protests. Its extent is disputed and unclear, but it is happening, and history has taught us there is no such thing as “antisemitism light.” While all forms of bigotry are condemnable, antisemitism carries a unique danger due to the long history of setting up Jews as the go-to, manufactured enemy. It's essential for any group advocating for a cause to actively combat any hateful messages that exploit our primal instincts to identify fake enemies. I believe the greatest threats to America aren't its true adversaries, but the voices that tell us to hurt others who pose no real danger. The Jewish girl leaving the library to get a manicure is not your mortal enemy. These hateful messages have such power because they trigger our deep enemy-identification system.

We join movements because of their goals, but also, increasingly, because joining makes us feel good . That's not an insult — joining is the reason we do everything; it triggers our reward system in some way. Camping out on college quads or barricading buildings is a social aphrodisiac. These experiences generate powerful feelings of common identity and give us the intense sense of “ belongingness ” we crave — especially among young people who lack the same connective tissue earlier generations enjoyed on campus. Covid and identity politics have sequestered and divided students from one another.

And of UCLA

At my alma mater UCLA on Tuesday night, counterprotesters attacked the pro-Palestine encampment and a multihour pitched battle ensued. Little of this has anything to do with the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. There's an African proverb that if a child does not feel the embrace of the tribe, they will burn it down to feel warmth. I wonder how many of the student protesters are burning the village to feel warmth. When enthusiasm overwhelms reasoned analysis, you find yourself on the steps of your college admin building demanding: “The revolution should be catered.” We should, and will, cut a wide berth for 19-year-olds pushing the boundaries of their intellectual freedom and testing limits. Put another way, they pay us to make mistakes in a safe environment. When their expression, however, impairs another student's right to a safe college experience, they should be suspended or expelled.

At UCLA, they expel 91% of the (potential) students during the application process. Shouldn't restricting the access of Jews to campus facilities be on par with not having perfect SATs? Elite universities need to accept, and exit, more students. Finally, there is, in my view, no excuse for any faculty or administrators to disrupt our mission to educate. They have a right to free speech, meaning they cannot be criminally charged for what they say. However, these are adults being paid to do a job, and when they make that job harder for the rest of us, or for the students and their families to even have a commencement ceremony, they should be fired .

Go into the lobby of any organization and start screaming at your fellow employees and setting up a tent in the cafeteria, and see how that turns out. The arrogance and self-aggrandizement of faculty at elite universities, who unilaterally changed their job description to “social engineer,” is obnoxious. You sign the back, not the front, of the college's checks — do your damn job.

愚蠢的

UC Berkeley Professor Carlo Cippolla developed a deft construct for identifying the “stupid”: people who hurt others while hurting themselves. We're all, at different points of our life, stupid. We instinctively turn on our parents (ie, when we are teens), because it makes it easier to leave the pack, and it's healthy to question the ways things have been done. “我恨你！” said every teen … at some point. We're also prone to stupidity and a lack of grace with our spouses and friends. Hate and envy are similar to Wi-Fi: hyperlocal. People who care about us often bear the brunt of our moods and disappointments, which have nothing to do with them. Students on campus who feel animosity for their country, not to mention their fellow students, are hurting others and themselves.

At home, in school, on the job, or in your community, do you register the commitment, goodwill, and love of the people closest to you? Or are you being stupid?
